title: Fertilizer Timing
content: Apply fertilizer early morning or evening to reduce evaporation and improve absorption.

title: Crop Rotation
content: Rotate crops every season to maintain soil fertility and prevent pest buildup.

title: Watering Guide
content: Water plants deeply but less frequently to encourage strong root development.

title: UCF GrowMax Usage
content: Use UCF GrowMax weekly during growing season for balanced nutrition and better yields.

title: Disease Detection
content: Check leaves regularly for yellowing or spots - early detection prevents major crop loss.

title: Soil Health
content: Mix organic compost with chemical fertilizers for sustainable soil health.

title: Plant Spacing
content: Ensure proper spacing between plants for adequate sunlight and air circulation.

title: Pest Control
content: Use neem oil spray as natural pest control before resorting to chemical pesticides.

title: Farm Diary
content: Maintain a farm diary to track fertilizer applications, rainfall, and crop performance.

title: Rain Warning
content: Avoid fertilizer application just before heavy rains to prevent nutrient runoff.

title: Soil pH
content: Monitor soil pH regularly - most crops prefer slightly acidic to neutral soil (6.0-7.0).

title: Nitrogen Application
content: Apply nitrogen fertilizers in split doses for better efficiency and reduced wastage.

title: Mulching
content: Use crop residues as mulch to conserve moisture and add organic matter to soil.

title: Soil Testing
content: Get soil tested every year to understand nutrient deficiencies and fertilizer requirements.

title: Phosphorus Usage
content: Apply phosphorus fertilizers at planting time for strong root and flower development.

title: Potassium Benefits
content: Use potassium-rich fertilizers during fruiting stage to improve fruit quality and shelf life.

title: Green Manuring
content: Practice green manuring by growing legumes and incorporating them into soil.

title: Foliar Feeding
content: Foliar feeding provides quick nutrient boost during critical growth stages.

title: Over-fertilization
content: Avoid over-fertilization - it can burn plants and pollute groundwater.

title: Field Hygiene
content: Maintain good field hygiene by removing diseased plants immediately to prevent spread.
